subject: Re: [junit] Heap size
msgSnippet: Mark, Failing early should be reasonably easy, if you have a trusted API for determining heap size.  Do you have a runner that would know how to fork a JVM, if
messageBody:
Mark,

Failing early should be reasonably easy, if you have a trusted API for
determining heap size. Do you have a runner that would know how to
fork a JVM, if the annotation existed?

David

On Tue, Jun 9, 2009 at 2:01 PM, Mark
Thornton<mark.p.thornton@...> wrote:
> I have some tests that require relatively large heap sizes to complete
> (eg 800MB). It would be useful to have an annotation to express this so
> that a runner could either fail early or fork a JVM with a suitable heap.
>
> Regards
> Mark Thornton
